title: What is the song that goes 'nah nah hey hey goodbye'? Has it been sampled in other tracks? - Quora

response.answer_text: The full title of the song is “Na Na Hey Hey Kiss Him Goodbye.” Original artist was a band called “Steam.” Covers of the song, of varying quality and success were made by The Supremes, the Belmonts (long after the heyday of Dion & the Belmonts obviously), the Nylons (Canadian group), Donna Summer and Bananarama. Riffs of some parts of the song have been suggested by some people, but nothing that probably was an intentional theft of the music, just more of a tribute to the popularity of the song included in passing in a wholly unrelated tune.

It’s Bananarama and the song is the exact same name that you asked about.  https://www.azlyrics.com/lyrics/bananarama/nanaheyheykisshimgoodbye.html Most successful girl band until the Spice Girls rolled round. This was a cover version and the original was by a band in the 1960s called Steam (weird promotional stuff for that as the band -all males- are all in a sauna). …and yes it’s been sampled many, many times…..most notably by Mr. J. Zed on his track D.O.A. (death of autotune), Lady Gaga - Chillin (both from 2009) and lastly Snoop Dogg - Light it up (2016).
